winners.tagline: Oncall Agent helps you respond to incidents faster. It's like having an extra engineer in your oncall rotation who is always focused and paying attention to what matters.

prizes.prize_name: LaunchDarkly: AI Agents of Change: most flexible/configurable Agent, using LaunchDarkly AI Configs
Best real-world application of Rime voices

description_sections.heading: Inspiration
description_sections.content: I'm a solo-builder with a million things to do. I've also been part of oncall rotations at companies that emphasize operational excellence so I know how much I'm slacking on taking care of my systems. I would LOVE to have an extra engineer whose always oncall, paying attention to system health and being a first line of defense.

description_sections.heading: Oncall mode
description_sections.content: Oncall agent behaves like a new addition to your oncall rotation. It checks system health and can respond to basic incidents by flipping off feature flags or rolling back deployments and notifying the team.

description_sections.heading: Retrospective mode
description_sections.content: Oncall agent will store notes and you can run a voice retrospective on any historical incidents.

description_sections.heading: What it does (Details)
description_sections.content: Oncall Agent integrates with Render and LaunchDarkly. It looks at your service metrics via Render's API to check on system health APIs. It correlates issues with recent feature flag changes and deploys and can flip flags or roll back changes. It will make API requests to probe health and analyze graphs of system metrics. It will announce audibly to the room if there is any issue and any important updates

description_sections.heading: Code
description_sections.content: Agent: https://github.com/MatthewDailey/hackathon-322-agent Web app for demo: https://github.com/MatthewDailey/hackathon-322-web

description_sections.heading: Built With
description_sections.content: anthropic elevenlabs gemini launchdarkly render rime

winners.project_title: ShipSense AI: Invoice Processing Agent for Enterprise
winners.tagline: ShipSense AI: Autonomous Invoice Agent That Validates, Enforces Policies, and Prevents Payment Delays â€” Automatically

description_sections.heading: Inspiration
description_sections.content: At my employer, an enterprise startup focused on debt financing workflows for Private Equity Firms, Debt Advisors, and Banks, we repeatedly heard a pain point from portfolio companies: manual invoice processing drains hundreds of hours monthly , delaying financial reporting and creating reconciliation headaches. These delays ripple across audits, debt covenants, and liquidity management. Yet enterprises still lose $600B annually to invoice errors and delays. Manual invoice processing is slow, error-prone, and lacks real-time policy checks. We built ShipSense AI to automate this high-velocity, low-criticality workflow â€” the perfect candidate for AI agent automation.

description_sections.heading: What it does
description_sections.content:
ShipSense AI is an autonomous invoice agent that:

Scrapes invoices from emails/PDFs using Apify Validates amounts, dates, and vendor terms using Gemini's reasoning (stopped mid-day when the network went off, so swapped out with Open AI for some time) Enforces compliance by cross-checking Senso.ai's policy database (future when we have API access) Acts proactively (e.g., auto-approves or flags violations, suggests compensation)

hosted on Render Product Design and architecture including System Design and PRD with Open Hands

Demo: [Watch the agent parse an invoice, detect a net-30 policy violation, and generate a discount code in <60 seconds.]

description_sections.heading: How we built it
description_sections.content: Scraping & Data Extraction : Apify crawlers for PDFs/emails + custom parsers Policy Engine : Senso.ai Documents API (preloaded vendor contracts) Reasoning & Action : Gemini chain-of-thought prompts to validate fields + suggest fixes Frontend : Streamlit UI showing agent's "thought process" (scraped data â†’ policy checks â†’ action) Mock APIs : Simulated ERP integrations (e.g., NetSuite) for approvals

description_sections.heading: Challenges we ran into
description_sections.content: PDF Hell : Handwritten invoices and non-standard formats broke initial Apify scrapers (solved with layout analysis) Policy Ambiguity : Senso.ai required strict schema mapping for Gemini to interpret "net-30" vs "30 days" Over-Automation Fear : Balancing agent autonomy vs human oversight (added "confidence scores" to flag low-certainty cases)

description_sections.heading: Accomplishments that we're proud of
description_sections.content: Integrated 3 sponsor tools (Apify, Senso.ai, Gemini) end-to-end in <4 hours Added proactive compensation logic (e.g., "5% discount if payment is late") vs just validation Built a live demo with visible agent reasoning (judges loved the transparency!)

description_sections.heading: What we learned
description_sections.content: Real-world data is messy : Even "simple" invoices vary wildly by industry Compliance â‰  Code : Enterprises need audit trails, not just automation UX Matters : Showing the agentâ€™s "thinking" built trust faster than a black box

description_sections.heading: What's next for ShipSense AI
description_sections.content: Global Scaling : Support non-English invoices (e.g., EU VAT codes) via Gemini multilingual Legacy ERP Integration : Replace mock APIs with SAP/Oracle connectors Anomaly Detection : Use Rime AI to flag suspicious vendor patterns Multimodal Actions : Send SMS/voice follow-ups via ElevenLabs + Twilio

description_sections.heading: Built With
description_sections.content: anthropic apify curlee cursor fastapi gemini node.js openai openhands python

winners.tagline: Get to know the founders you are investing in - the good, bad, and ugly.

description_sections.heading: Inspiration
description_sections.content: Simon Tiu, Vertex Investor who spoke at the start of the presentation talked about the challenges with due diligence and the need for AI agentic flows. We talked to him and found out the due diligence to understand if founder for firm investing is has any red flags/risks, and we wanted to build a technology that can do right that.

description_sections.heading: What it does
description_sections.content: Investor Inputs : Investor enters name, phone, email, linkedin. Founder Form : Bot pressures the founder to fill out a form. AI Scrapes Data : AI agents gather data from various sources (sanctions lists, websites, news, corporate registries). Report Generation : A risk score and recommendations are provided to the investor.

description_sections.heading: How we built it
description_sections.content: LLM Integration : Uses Gemini API for NLP processing. Data Scraping : Leverages LaunchDarkly and Apify for scraping data. Risk Assessment : AI generates a risk score based on the data. AWS Email and SQL : Be able to send email to founders and their acquaintances

description_sections.heading: Challenges we ran into
description_sections.content: Integration of system and not a lot of time (6-7 hour hackathon) so things needed to be scoped quick

description_sections.heading: Accomplishments that we're proud of
description_sections.content: App works and leverage different sponsor activities

description_sections.heading: What we learned
description_sections.content: Useful chatting directly to developers from sponsored companies to understand their technology

description_sections.heading: What's next for Know Your Founder
description_sections.content: Get feedback from investors and expand features.

winners.tagline: Equilibrium optimizes and automates procurement: buyer agent negotiates with multiple seller agents on the SKU, quantity, price, delivery time and make transaction on Solana.

prizes.prize_name: Best real-world application of Rime voices

description_sections.heading: Inspiration
description_sections.content: Take a dentistry. The dentistry needs to buy various supplies pretty much all the time. Lets imagine rubber gloves are running out. Dentistry uses Equilibrium:SOL to negotiate best procurement conditions, escalating to owner if needed using AI Human. Transaction happens on Solana.

description_sections.heading: What it does
description_sections.content:
Dentistry has buyer agents which gets triggered (eg supply runs low or customer influx anticipated) to make a purchase.

First purchase preparation agent:

researches the current market price for the product (Apify scraping Alibaba & Amazon) uses LLM to cleanup and normalize pricing data (eg price per glove and minimum order size)

Negotiation agent:

talks to seller agents and negotiates the price/volume/timeline (without revealing all the info upfront)

Solana Contract:

after negotiation buyer and sellers enter the contract on Solana (purchase)

Human escalation:

If during negotiation buyer is stuck it uses Tavus to call the business owner and explains the isse Business owner may abort or continue transaction

description_sections.heading: How we built it
description_sections.content:
Tools used:

All the code (Typescript, Svelte) runs on Render Prompts, model, config management: LaunchDarkly LLM interactions are recorded on Langtrace Seller agents are authenticated on Stytch Negotiation workflow is managed on Cloudflare:Workflows

description_sections.heading: Challenges we ran into
description_sections.content: listings on Alibaba are confusing hard to make LLMs negotiate without revealing all details

description_sections.heading: Accomplishments that we're proud of
description_sections.content: Working end-to-end Natural language negotiation and Solana contracts Nice handling of escalations

description_sections.heading: What we learned
description_sections.content: Talking to AI human is cool Classic engineering problems (flags, cloud, scraping) are evergreen Agent authentication is important (thanks Stytch) Gemini is fast Solana is awesome Tracing LLMs is a must OpenHands rocks!

description_sections.heading: What's next for Equilibrium:SOL
description_sections.content: It might end up in a real SaaS!

description_sections.content: langtrace launchdarkly openhands render solana stytch svelete typescript

winners.tagline: When Manus meets your Loom Videos and does all the repeatable tasks for you

description_sections.heading: Inspiration
description_sections.content: We set out to make workflow automation something anyone can use, no tech skills needed. We came from the idea of blending dead-simple screen recording with smart AI to let people automate tasks just by showing what they do.

description_sections.heading: What It Does
description_sections.content: Harmony lets you record your screen as you work, and the AI figures out the steps to build a workflow for you. No coding, no fussâ€”it works with any web app out there. Itâ€™s fast, cuts down mistakes, and scales your processes like a breeze.

description_sections.heading: How We Built It
description_sections.content: We powered Harmony with cutting-edge AI that watches your loom videos and mimics what you do in software. The interface? Super intuitive and no-code, so you donâ€™t need to mess with tech setup or APIs to get started.

description_sections.heading: Challenges
description_sections.content: Getting the AI to nail a huge variety of workflows from recordings wasnâ€™t easyâ€”it took serious work. Plus, we had to keep it simple for non-tech folks, which meant tons of testing and tweaking.

description_sections.heading: Proud Moments
description_sections.content: Weâ€™re stoked that Harmony can whip up workflows in seconds. It plays nice with any web app (no APIs needed) and keeps getting smarter the more itâ€™s used. Thatâ€™s what makes it legit.

description_sections.heading: What We Learned
description_sections.content: Building this taught us how to train AI to act human in apps and how to craft a no-code tool that makes tricky automation feel effortless.

description_sections.heading: Next Up
description_sections.content: Weâ€™re leveling up the AI to tackle even tougher workflows, adding more ways to tweak it, and eyeing bigger teams and companies to roll it out to.

description_sections.heading: Built With
description_sections.content: apify deepmind gemini stytch tavus windsurf

winners.tagline: Legal Counsel AI: State-of-the-art legal reasoning engine that transforms complex legal analysis with multi-methodology thinking, expert consultation, and practical workflow integration.

description_sections.heading: Inspiration
description_sections.content: The legal industry remains largely untransformed by AI despite massive potential. When reviewing existing legal AI solutions, we found they often operate as simple document reviewers or generic chatbots lacking authentic legal reasoning. We were inspired to create something fundamentally different - a system that thinks like a lawyer by applying formal legal reasoning methodologies, consulting multiple expert perspectives, and integrating with real legal workflows to deliver practical outputs that actually help legal professionals work more effectively.

description_sections.heading: What it does
description_sections.content:
LexCounsel AI provides sophisticated legal analysis through multiple complementary capabilities:

Multi-Methodology Legal Reasoning - Analyzes legal questions using various formal approaches (textual analysis, statutory interpretation, case-based reasoning) with step-by-step reasoning chains Expert Consultation System - Simulates consultations with different legal specialists (contract law, employment, litigation) for multi-perspective analysis Document Processing - Extracts structure, identifies issues, and assesses risks in legal documents Interactive Legal Exploration - Allows users to explore legal issues, risks, and strategies with an interactive cognitive system Practice Integration - Transforms analyses into practical outputs like client memos and task lists that integrate with existing legal workflows

description_sections.heading: How we built it
description_sections.content:
We architectured LexCounsel as a sophisticated reasoning engine with a modular backend and intuitive frontend:

Backend : Built with FastAPI in Python, implementing specialized components for each reasoning method and expert domain AI Core : Leveraged Google Gemini for advanced reasoning capabilities with carefully designed prompting strategies that elicit structured legal analysis Voice Integration : Incorporated ElevenLabs for natural voice synthesis of legal explanations with appropriate emphasis on legal terminology Explainability : Implemented Langtrace for transparency in the reasoning process Frontend : Developed with Next.js and TypeScript to create an intuitive, professional interface that visualizes complex legal analyses

description_sections.heading: Challenges we ran into
description_sections.content: Authentic Legal Reasoning : Implementing genuine legal thinking patterns beyond simple Q&A required designing specialized prompting strategies and reasoning frameworks Balancing Sophistication with Usability : Creating a system that provides nuanced analysis while remaining accessible to non-technical legal users Structuring Complex Outputs : Developing visualizations for multi-faceted legal analyses that maintain detail while providing clear conclusions Integration Complexity : Coordinating multiple sponsor technologies (Google Gemini, ElevenLabs, Langtrace) into a cohesive system Time Constraints : Building a sophisticated legal reasoning system within the hackathon's tight timeframe

description_sections.heading: Accomplishments that we're proud of
description_sections.content: Developing a legal AI that genuinely replicates legal thinking patterns rather than just pattern-matching Creating a multi-agent system where different legal experts collaborate on analysis Building an interactive exploration system that explains its reasoning transparently Implementing practical workflow integration that delivers client-ready outputs Successfully integrating multiple sponsor technologies into a cohesive system

description_sections.heading: What we learned
description_sections.content: Legal reasoning requires specialized frameworks beyond general language understanding Multi-perspective analysis produces more balanced and comprehensive legal insights Transparency in AI reasoning is crucial for professional adoption in legal contexts Integration with existing workflows is essential for practical legal technology Even sophisticated AI needs clear confidence scoring and expert oversight in legal applications

description_sections.heading: What's next for LexCounsel
description_sections.content: Authority Integration : Connecting to legal research databases for citation-backed analysis Specialized Practice Modules : Developing focused capabilities for areas like M&A, compliance, and litigation Collaborative Features : Enabling multiple legal professionals to work together through the platform Customizable Reasoning : Allowing firms to train the system on their preferred legal approaches Jurisdiction Expansion : Adding support for multiple legal jurisdictions beyond US law

winners.tagline: A fun, immersive language-learning tool for memorizing words based on your interests!

prizes.prize_name: Best real-world application of Rime voices

description_sections.heading: Inspiration
description_sections.content: Language learning can be tedious, especially when memorizing new words out of context. Traditional flashcards and rote memorization often fail to engage users in a meaningful way. We wanted to create a fun, immersive, and interest-driven vocabulary learning tool that helps users remember words more effectively by connecting them to topics they loveâ€”whether itâ€™s sports, business, technology, or pop culture.

description_sections.heading: What it does
description_sections.content: Do You Remember is an AI-powered language learning tool that allows users to: 1. Generate personalized vocabulary lists based on their interests. 2. Create interactive flashcards with contextual information, including definitions, examples, etymology, and fun facts. 3. Automatically fetch relevant images and videos from the web to enhance word association. 4. Generate high-quality text-to-speech audio for pronunciation practice. 5. Seamlessly export vocabulary lists to Anki for long-term retention.

description_sections.heading: How we built it
description_sections.content: â€¢ Frontend: Built with Next.js, ensuring a smooth user experience. â€¢ Backend: Developed using Next.js, handling requests for vocabulary generation and content enrichment. â€¢ AI & NLP: Integrated google cloud API & ConceptNet for word associations and GPT-powered card generation. â€¢ Web Scraping: Used Apify to fetch relevant images and videos for each word to add to the flashcards and facilitate the language learning process. â€¢ Text-to-Speech: Implemented Rime API for generating high-quality MP3 pronunciation files. â€¢ Anki Integration: Anki is a flashcard-based learning software with both web and desktop applications. We automated CSV/JSON file generation and AnkiConnect API for direct import.

description_sections.heading: Challenges we ran into
description_sections.content: â€¢ Ensuring AI-generated vocabulary lists are contextually relevant and avoid irrelevant words. â€¢ Managing API rate limits while fetching images and videos in real-time. â€¢ Integrating high-quality text-to-speech without latency issues. â€¢ Handling structured CSV/JSON export for Anki, ensuring compatibility with user-defined templates.

description_sections.heading: Accomplishments that we're proud of
description_sections.content: âœ… Successfully automated the entire flashcard creation processâ€”from topic input to Anki-ready output. âœ… Integrated multiple AI services (GPT, Rime TTS, Apify) into a seamless workflow. âœ… Built a responsive and intuitive UI that allows users to engage with vocabulary interactively. âœ… Optimized the system for scalability, making it adaptable for future enhancements.

description_sections.heading: What we learned
description_sections.content: The importance of user context: Simply generating vocabulary isnâ€™t enoughâ€”providing engaging and meaningful content is key to retention. â€¢ Efficient API usage: Balancing API calls while ensuring fast response times is crucial for user experience. â€¢ The power of automation: Automating the vocabulary-to-Anki pipeline significantly enhances learning efficiency. â€¢ Web scraping optimizations: Selecting the right images/videos improves memory retention but requires careful filtering to ensure relevance.

description_sections.heading: What's next for Do You Remeber
description_sections.content: ðŸš€ Enhanced Personalization: Fine-tune vocabulary selection with user feedback loops and difficulty settings. ðŸŽ® Gamification Elements: Introduce challenges, leaderboards, and spaced repetition quizzes. ðŸ“± Mobile App Integration: Expand beyond web-based tools for on-the-go learning. ðŸŒŽ Multilingual Support: Enable learning in multiple languages, helping more users worldwide. ðŸ¤– Voice Interaction: Allow users to speak and receive real-time feedback on pronunciation.

winners.tagline: Transform your brand with interactive avatars. SoldOut provides live interactive avatars that enhance customer engagement, boost conversions, and increase average order value effortlessly.

description_sections.heading: Inspiration
description_sections.content: Live shopping is projected to hit $55 billion by 2026 in the US. Buyers want to buy from someone relatable. Our avatars give e-commerce businesses that capability.

description_sections.heading: What it does
description_sections.content: Creates an interactive avatar salesperson based on your choice of real-world persona.

description_sections.heading: How we built it
description_sections.content: Developed on Windsurf. Using Apify to scrape the client website, Google Vertex to parse the content, and Tavis to create and display the avatar, hosted on Render. Due to today's time constraints, we used a stock avatar, but the customer can choose their own.

description_sections.heading: Challenges we ran into
description_sections.content: Wi-Fi slowed us down. Dev Ops snafus on my laptop.

description_sections.heading: Accomplishments that we're proud of
description_sections.content: Good teamwork, and executing a genuinely new (to us) concept in the space of one afternoon.

description_sections.heading: What we learned
description_sections.content: So many new technologies to play with.

description_sections.heading: What's next for Virtually Irresistible

description_sections.heading: Inspiration
description_sections.content: Understanding existing codebases can be overwhelming, especially when dealing with large, complex repositories with minimal documentation. Navigating unfamiliar architectures, deciphering dependencies, and grasping business logic can take hours, if not days. This challenge inspired us to create a solution that accelerates comprehension and onboarding for developers.

description_sections.heading: What it does
description_sections.content: Our project is designed to streamline the onboarding process for developers by analyzing GitHub repositories and generating human-like AI-driven onboarding videos. We achieve this by first scanning the entire codebase, extracting key information about the project's structure, dependencies, and functionality. Using an advanced AI model, we then summarize the repositoryâ€™s purpose, tech stack, and key usage instructions.## How we built it

description_sections.heading: Challenges we ran into
description_sections.content: One of the biggest challenges we faced was the time it took to generate the Tavus videos. Since our project involves analyzing GitHub repositories and converting that information into a human-like AI onboarding video, we needed a fast and efficient way to process and render these videos.

description_sections.heading: Accomplishments that we're proud of
description_sections.content: One of our biggest accomplishments is having a fully functional end-to-end product that successfully analyzes GitHub repositories and generates AI-powered onboarding videos. This project represents a significant step toward bridging the gap between code understanding and effective team onboarding.

description_sections.heading: What we learned
description_sections.content: Throughout this project, we gained valuable insights into understanding complex codebases, developing better strategies for analyzing large repositories, and extracting meaningful information efficiently. We also deepened our knowledge of API integration and automation by working with GitHub's API, Google Gemini, and Tavus AI to streamline repository analysis and video generation. Additionally, we explored the computational challenges of AI-generated content, particularly the time-intensive nature of producing high-quality onboarding videos, and worked on optimizing our process for better efficiency.

description_sections.heading: What's next for LaunchPad
description_sections.content: As we continue to refine and expand LaunchPad, our immediate goal is to build a real-time agent capable of answering user questions in an intelligent, dynamic, and personalized manner. This step represents a major leap forward in our mission to deliver cutting-edge AI solutions that are not only functional but can seamlessly interact with users in a natural, intuitive way.

winners.tagline: Our agents eliminate the cold start problem for e-commerce. Our three AI agents scrape social profiles, analyze user preferences, and autonomously self-optimize recommendations.

description_sections.heading: Inspiration
description_sections.content:
Rohan, Matthew, and Jonathan grew up in the same town in Illinois. We came with an interest in AI agents and enhanced personalization in software. We spoke with several sponsors and identified key problems in industry that can now be solved for the first time using AI agents.

We learned from the COO of Apify that businesses use Apify to pull user context to provide personalized experiences. Private equity firms need additional agents to enrich this data for due diligence.

We learned from e-commerce store owners and software applications that businesses and applications face a "cold-start" with no data on new users and are forced to provide generic experiences.

description_sections.heading: What it does
description_sections.content:
Our software solves the cold start problem by:

User enters site hosted by Render Apify actor ingests user social context Gemini backend research AI Agent analyzes user context to determine user preferences for unique application (i.e. food preferences, dating preferences.) Agent self-learns and improves prompts based on LaunchDarkly performance analyses Through testing, prompts are autonomously improved by an agent that judges responses and user activity (clicks, conversions, etc). Site bootstraps a recommendation system from scratch.

description_sections.heading: How we built it
description_sections.content: We used a frontend that intakes username. The username passed into our service, which then returns a list of recommendations. On the front end, it will send the user preferences back to our service, which would then pass it into a judge model, which would pick out what went wrong with the prompt, and readjust the prompt, and use that prompt for future users. It's continuous feedback for new users to the applications.

description_sections.heading: Challenges we ran into
description_sections.content:
Similar to smaller e-commerce stores, we do not have extensive data sets that large companies use to optimize recommendation systems.

In order to surpass this hurdle, we bootstrapped an AI agent that autonomously self-improves recommendations by judging recommendation quality and evolving the prompts to provide enhanced recommendations for any site.

description_sections.heading: Accomplishments that we're proud of
description_sections.content: Many e-commerce website rely on pre-trained models that rely on on-site clicks and shallow behaviors. Our agents successfully leap over these hurdles and provide a step-function in personalization.

description_sections.heading: What we learned
description_sections.content: We were really impressed with Apify. We were able to gather context from a variety of sources. We stayed narrow in our initial features but can see ourselves expanding context broadly.

description_sections.heading: What's next for Bronco
description_sections.content:
We are going to seek customers who may want to eliminate high-friction onboarding or shallow personalization to immediately provide intimate personalization at scale.

We also want to implement Sherlock, which we learned is a valuable tool that, given a username, can detect similar social profiles and aggregate context into one pull for user analysis.

description_sections.heading: Built With
description_sections.content: python
